text: Il mange, elle boit, c'est comme ci, comme ça.
J'ai seulement goûté à la poutine mais dans la catégorie des "grosses poutines graisseuses" elle est délicieuse! Beaucoup meilleure que celle de La Belle Province ou autres restos de ce genre.

It is what it is: a family-run greasy spoon/casse-croute, that hasn't changed much over time other than the new-ish (and unfortunate) sign outside.   Don't expect anything fancy, but for what it's worth, the food is decent and the prices are still very low. I find their poutine to be one of the better ones in the area, and I like their burgers too though. Again, they're nothing out of this world but at under $3 if I remember correctly, it hits the spot.   They close late-ish  (11pm on most nights) which is nice since everything closes pretty early in the area. It would be nice if they closed after the bars did, at least on weekends, but what can ya do.   Service is always a bit peculiar, with a very high turnover of waiting staff and the same old dad jokes at the cash but it comes with the territory.
Awesome, simple, fast, neighbourhood diner. Great hamburgers, breakfast, fries and poutine. Go before 11:30 for cheap breakfast.

If you're looking for " character " this is your place. Best $10 club sandwich plate in town. Perfect French fries. My favourite greasy spoon, hands down. Nick, one of the cooks, sings all the time "il fait beau!" And jokes with EVERYONE about how much your meal cost you, which might seem tiring but for me just adds to the charm. Just watch out for the drinks spilling out from the sports bar next door.

i'm all about greasy food, but this place is underwhelming at best. i live nearby so i go once in a blue moon when nothing else is open. the fries are alright, but the onion rings are probably the worst i've ever had.   all that aside, i almost got run over by a nouveau system delivery car last week, who seriously sped up as i was crossing the street at a pedestrian crosswalk. be wary!

After now going for breakfast , lunch and dinner many times, it's worth the 5 stars.  I always take the "Special" 2 eggs "tournés", bacon and brown toast.   The waitresses are quick with the coffee and the dish arrives in seconds.  The place is pretty busy but I don't feel rushed to finish the newspaper.

I need this place to never change. It's friendly and funny and full of perfect fried things. You can still get a cheap breakfast here that's hugely filling with bottomless coffee and fresh fruit. You can get a great steamie, a massive poutine for like $5, a pizza, a pepperoni sub, basically everything good.   I love the owner and staff, they wave when I walk by, they crack jokes as they cook and chat with regulars, and crank out hot, fresh food. I love the vinyl booths, the big menu and the much bigger heart. Support your local casse croûte people, these are the bits of history that keep neighbourhoods alive!!

Pour ceux qui veulent retrouver la forme et se mettre en bikini, cet avis est à déconseiller. Pour ceux qui cherchent un bon burger, une bonne poutine sans trop de fla fla, Nouveau Système est le parfait endroit. Ce qui est le plus cool de cette place, c'est que vous pouvez passer votre commande, elle sera prête hyper rapidement (moins de 10 minutes et des fois, même moins de 5), et vous pouvez l'emmenez au bar d'à côté si vous préférez rincer votre fast-food avec une bière. C'est bon pour ce que c'est et ça n'est pas cher. Les banquettes sont confortables et le service hors pairs. Oui, oui. Même pour un "dinner" à la québécoise, le service est excellent. Donc quand l'envie d'un p'tite bouffe graisseuse vous prend, c'est un endroit à considérer. C'est aussi simple que ça!
